name: Clay Sculpting Workshop
description: Treat yourself to the therapeutic experience of sculpting, and learn how to create a piece of art unique to you. No experience needed.

name: Yoga in Trillium Park
description:
Classes take place next to the Pavilion and are led by experienced instructors and combine elements of hatha and vinyasa yoga, emphasizing mindfulness, core strength, and fostering a deeper connection between breath and movement. 

Classes are open to participants of all levels and run rain or shine. No registration required, just bring your mat, water bottle and sunscreen.

name: Scented Candle Making Workshop
description: Select personalized scents, and work with organic soy wax which burns cleaner, and lasts longer. Take your candles home with you that day and enjoy your new custom scented creations.

name: Remote Gallery Art Market and Exhibition
description: To celebrate the recent expansion of Remote Gallery, we are thrilled to invite you! Featuring the creative talent of Akin members from our 8 locations across Toronto including painters, ceramicists, jewelry makers, printmakers, sculptors, illustrators and more.

name: Hogtown Roller Derby

location.name: Ted Reeve Arena - Main St and Danforth Ave

description:
Back with a double header you won’t want to miss! 

Game One features the Hogtown Jr. Jaw Breakers vs. Tri-City Junior Roller Derby, Game Two features two of our brand new intraleague home teams face off in their first public showdown, Team Orange vs. Team Green. Come cheer for your fave colour!

name: Ghost Signs of Toronto Walking Tour
description:
Uncover the hidden history of Toronto’s ghost signs and advertising relics that reveal how early Canadian commerce used imagery, typography, and emotion to persuade purchases and influence a national identity. Learn how to spot these disappearing relics and become a ghost hunter of the signs of Toronto's past.

This 1.1 kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Stephan Petar. Stephan is an award-winning publicist and Heritage Toronto Award-winning writer. A born and raised Torontonian, he is passionate about the city’s heritage and architecture.

name: Unstoppable Women Leading Change Seminar
description:
Are you a woman trying to start over in Canada? We see you and want you to know, you don’t have to do this alone. This journey can feel overwhelming, but we’re building something just for you. 

Join us for mental health and emotional well-being support, learn financial confidence and stability, resources on how to defend against violence and advice on what to do in case of divorce. Gain real connection, support, and community. We can’t wait to welcome you.

name: Toronto Comic Arts Festival (TCAF)
description:
Join us for one of the largest independent comic arts festivals in the world. Each year, TCAF welcomes 28,000+ visitors and 350+ artists from across Canada and around the world to our free celebration of independent comics. 

Meet the creators of your favourite comics and shop their latest releases. Learn about the historical and contemporary trends in comics through panel talks, Q&As, workshops, and artist spotlights. Bring your kids! TCAF is all-ages, with drawing and creation workshops and comics storytimes led by educators and library workers.

name: More Noise Please! Presents - An Evening of Noise And Wild Experimental Sounds
description: Featuring Pet Retina from Victoria, B.C., Colin Fisher, Nimaah, Stefan Powell, and Owen Kurtz.

name: Handbuilt Ceramics with Parkdale Pottery
description:
Dive into pinch pot, coil, and slab-building techniques, crafting anything from cute cups to colourful dishes! Expert potters will guide you through every step of the handbuilt ceramics process. Then, add your personal touch with vibrant painted underglazes. Parkdale Pottery will finish and fire your pieces in their kiln. Your creations will be ready for pickup in just 4 weeks!

Don’t forget to explore MOCA’s current exhibitions featuring the sculptural installations of Jessica Stockholder and Alex Da Corte for inspiration.

name: Ontario Science Centre - Indigenous Celebration at Harbourfront Centre
description: Celebrate National Indigenous History Month! Engage in interactive workshops, performances,  book signing with North of North TV star, Maika Harper, and hands-on activities that engage in Indigenous ways of knowing. Family-friendly, all are welcome.

name: First Story Toronto at Colborne Lodge
description:
Join Indigenous storytellers for a guided  tour of the place now known as High Park. 

Beginning at Colborne Lodge Museum, the 1837 settler home of John and Jemima Howard, First Story will share knowledge about diverse Indigenous cultures, histories and ongoing Indigenous actions of environmental stewardship.

There are limited spots avaialble for this tour. First come, first served.

name: ExperienceTO: High Park Historical Tour
description: Join us for a public walking tour that will be a good experience for anyone; whether you’re 8 or 80 years old, and whether you’re a curious local, solo traveler, backpacker, part of a small groups of friends, or a newcomer.

name: Westlake Park National Indigenous History Month Tree Planting Event
description:
Join us for a special planting event with Vivian Recollet, an Anishinaabe grandmother, who will lead a ceremony at the beginning of the event. The ceremony will be followed by planting trees and shrubs to enhance natural habitat at Westlake Park.

Event site conditions vary. Contact us for more information including accessibility. If you would like to request accessibility support, contact us as soon as possible.

name: Community Environment Day at Richview Collegiate
description:
Join Councillor Holyday (Ward 2) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Hiking’s A Drag: Storytime With Fay & Fluffy in High Park

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don’t exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park’s ecologically sensitive trails. 

Get outside for a fabulous morning of tales and trails with drag artists Fay & Fluffy of the award-winning The Fabulous Show! We’ll start by listening to Fay & Fluffy read their favourite stories then we’ll head out on a nature hike with the Nature Centre to discover what’s happening in the park!

This event is family-friendly and for the young at heart! Part of the event will involve hiking on trails that are uneven and unpaved for about 45 minutes.

name: World Environment Day Picnic Celebration
description: Enjoy live music by local artists, food vendors using reusable dishware, eco-friendly pop-ups, fun family activities, a tree giveaway and more. World Environment Day encourages people to adopt sustainable practices and create innovative solutions for a healthier planet. This year’s theme is “Beat Plastic Pollution” and encourages people to rethink how we use and dispose of plastic.

name: Learning from the Land: Indigenous teachings reawaken Todmorden’s past and connection to the land

address.streetAddress: MJPR+78 Todmorden Mills Park, 67 Pottery Rd

description: Join us for this installation and guided walk that invites visitors to experience the themes of preserving a home, ecology and manufacturing. Led by Indigenous Knowledge Keeper Alan Colley, together with the team at Todmorden Mills, this experience honours Indigenous connections to the land while sharing the layered histories of the site. Learn how the land has been cared for and used by Indigenous Peoples and reflect on the changing landscape shaped by human and ecological relationships through drawing or writing in the Papermill Gallery.

name: Pinoy Fiesta and Trade Show Toronto

location.name: Albert Campbell Square (behind Scarborough Town Centre Mall)

description: We're celebrating our 15th Year Anniversary! Join the celebration for all-day entertainment, food, giveaways and surprise guests. Tara na, let's go!

organizer.name: Pinoy Fiesta & Trade Show sa Toronto

name: So What is Manga and Why Does It Matter? A Walkthrough with School Librarian Jillian Rudes
description:
Do you know the secret power of manga, also known as Japanese Comics? Not just fun to read!

Join us for an inspiring lecture with Jillian Rudes, award-winning librarian and author of "Manga in Libraries". Learn how manga can spark literacy, social-emotional learning, and confidence in readers at libraries, classrooms, and homes! 

Great for educators and library workers, parents and children who love manga, manga fans who are curious how manga can change lives.

name: Vibrante Art Show
description:
Back for the third time this summer, we are partnering up again with the festival Salsa on St Clair. Vibrante will once again explore the colour and vibrancy of the Latino culture. Featuring 40 creatives in celebration of young artistic talent. For our opening reception, we will have a live performance by a young musician and our juror, OCAD University professor David Griffin, will present the awards (sponsored by TLN) to the artists. The opening will feature themed drinks and a TV crew interviewing artists.

The Little EGG Gallery is an art gallery only for emerging artists. Featured on Hyperallergic, Reader's Digest, Artsy, CBC TV, The Art Newspaper, Toronto Star, TLN TV and more.

name: June Weekends at Scarborough Museum
description:
On weekends in June, join Scarborough Museum for reflective, hands-on and community-informed activities that invite participation, expression and connection. Enjoy a refreshing drink and snack prepared in the museum's kitchens, share a memory in a collaborative textile collage, or take time and space to listen, read, and reflect on stories of self-discovery, care, and resilience in the museum's story corner, featuring books by 2SLGBTQIA+ authors and illustrators.

Curated in collaboration with youth from Toby’s Place, a Scarborough-based organization that supports queer and trans youth, this month's programs are shaped by their voices, creativity, and lived experiences.

name: Lakeshore Village Grilled Cheese Challenge
description:
The Lakeshore Village BIA welcome’s back their annual street festival in June!

The Grilled Cheese Challenge is Ontario’s largest celebration of grilled cheese sandwiches; featuring live music, entertainment, family fun zones, amazing food, specialty drinks, beverage gardens, shopping and much more!

name: Through the Garden Gate

location.name: Hoggs Hollow Neighbourhood - parking lot beside Jolly Miller Park

description:
One of Toronto’s largest tours of private gardens. Garden-goers will have the opportunity to visit 14 residential gardens, of varying sizes and themes in the unique Toronto enclave of Hoggs Hollow.

Knowledgeable Toronto Master Gardeners will be stationed in each garden and are happy to answer plant and garden design questions. Enjoy onsite pop-ups with musicians, neighbourhood and history experts, including the North York Historical Society and Lost Rivers. 

All proceeds from the tour support the Toronto Botanical Garden.

name: Scarborough Walk to End ALS
description: A community-driven event for people living with or affected by ALS as well as those who want to help create a world free of ALS. It is more than just a fundraiser, it is a community builder and a place of connection. A place to celebrate, to remember, to support each other and demonstrate just how strong we are as a community.

name: Burn Baby, Burn
description:
This performance blends beauty and chaos, exploring humanity’s power to ignite change. As the flames rise, the question lingers—can we spark an intentional backfire before spiraling beyond control?

Presented in partnership with TO Live and Show One Productions.

name: Intro to Square Dancing
description: It's time to get moving and meet new friends. Join our special Pride edition of learning how to square dance. No partner or experience is required.

name: SickKids 150th Birthday Celebration

address.streetAddress: Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen St W

description:
Join us to celebrate a century and a half of firsts, fights and forward thinking! As 150th celebrations continue, we’re bringing an unforgettable experience and birthday hot air balloon to Toronto, lifting people and spirits.

This is the final balloon of the 150 placed across Canada and around the globe, each marking milestones in SickKids’ history, and we couldn't be happier to share this momentous occasion with you!

You won't want to miss the family-friendly activities, dazzling performances, inspiring remarks, a special guest appearance, and mouth-watering treats at this birthday bash.

name: Women’s Healthy Living Show
description:
Women’s health takes centre stage at this event curated for women aged 30 and over. It offers an immersive and empowering experience that addresses the full spectrum of wellness, including mental, emotional and physical health, as well as burnout, finances, relationships, skincare, menopause and more. 

Don’t miss an inspiring lineup of seminars, panels and small group workshops, headlined by Tracy Moore and Dina Pugliese and featuring a dynamic roster of experts. Official charity partner, Sinai Health Foundation, will contribute leading medical voices to the conversation. Plus, shop a diverse selection of products across health, wellness, beauty, sex, nutrition and self-care.

name: Youth Pride Queerapalooza - Paint it Rainbow
description:
Calling 2SLGBTQ+ youth, families, and allies, ages 6 to 21. Be loud and proud, and join community for a Pride celeGAYtion!

Look forward to music by DJ Psi, shows by Rainbow Circus, face painting, games, crafts, and sports, food, fun and more.

 Collectively, we strive to create a safer, supportive, and inspiring space where everyone can bring their full selves, feel celebrated and continue to develop and strengthen their skills in self-expression.

name: Riverside Eats and Beats

location.name: Riverside - Queen Street E between Davies Ave and Empire Ave

description:
Taste the eats and feel the beats! Spanning 10 vibrant blocks along Queen Street East between Don Valley and the world-famous De Grassi Street. 

In our eleventh year, we will feature over 50 local eateries and shops serving food tasters, sidewalk sales, and specials. Destination points at five local street closures along Queen East and two local parks including local markets, beer garden, culinary delights, family-friendly activities, and entertainment. Free activities include live music, magic shows, face-painting, food and drink specials, giveaways and more!

name: York Plays 2025
description:
Come experience the York Corpus Christi Plays as they were performed in 14th-century England! Featuring 50 plays performed sequentially by 17 North American theatre groups. Each play will be performed on replica wagons, recreating the mobile staging practices of medieval York.

Come and go as you please, plays repeat at three different spots, so wander between them, grab a snack, and enjoy at your own pace. Open to all ages, bring blankets, folding chairs, sunhats, and maybe a raincoat!

name: Exhibition "Breaking Binaries" by Cheryl HJ Lee
description:
The Riverdale Hub Gallery is pleased to announce the exhibition "Breaking Binaries" by Cheryl HJ Lee.

Cheryl HJ Lee, a Korean-born Canadian artist, shifted her creative journey from Vancouver to Toronto after moving to Canada at 16. Cheryl creates unique landscape paintings using acrylic and oil paints to explore the interplay between light and dark, reality and imagination. By focusing on light sources such as windows, traffic lights and reflections on a textured, dark background, she invites viewers to interpret each painting in their own imaginative way.

name: A Terracotta Pot Painting Workshop
description: Decorate your own terracotta pots and plant herb seeds inside, leaving with something handmade, beautiful, and ready to grow.

name: The Princess Margaret Ride to Conquer Cancer 2025
description:
The Ride is a unique two-day cycling fundraiser during which 4000+ participants will cycle over 200 kilometers between the City of Toronto and the Town of Niagara-on-the-Lake.

This year we are celebrating 18 years of contributions to life-changing cancer research, with over $300 million raised for The Princess Margaret Cancer Centre. For more information, please visit our website. 

Interested in volunteering?
If you would like to volunteer or know anyone who would be interested in volunteering at this event, you can follow this link to register: https://pmcfvolunteer.rosterfy.com/

name: I am Scarborough - Community Arts Project at Scarborough Museum
description:
“I am Scarborough” is a community arts project that invites Scarborough residents of all ages and backgrounds to join in art workshops to explore a diverse range of art techniques, resulting in a community-engaged art installation. Join in the fun this summer and continue this exciting project facilitated by Kseniya Tsoy!

Kseniya Tsoy is a community-engaged artist originally from Uzbekistan and a recipient of the Newcomer Arts Award from Toronto Arts Foundation. In the community, she is best known for her whimsical collaborative public art murals and installations where community members are engaged in all stages of the creative process. Kseniya uses vibrant colours, bold minimalist shapes and uplifting messages to create whimsical and playful artwork that inspire joy.

name: Iconique – A Pride Celebration Concert
description: Join us for a spectacular Pride concert, celebrating the powerful voices of queer icons through song. As Canada’s largest 2SLGBTQQIA+ choir, we’re proud to showcase our amazing membership with a show filled with anthems from some of the most influential queer artists. You’ll experience breathtaking vocal arrangements, and come early to see Gayly Forward Marching Band. This official Toronto Pride Affiliate event is a night you won’t want to miss!

name: Echoes of India and New Voices of Canada
description:
ECC will present a unique musical program with both global and local connections to wrap up our 2024-2025 season.  The choir will begin by performing a variety of Indian music, both traditional and contemporary, in its authentic context of languages, instruments and performance style.  

In part two, this concert marks the premiere of new choral music from the Toronto-based writing team of Henstra and Renglich.  The choir will be accompanied in these new works by an ensemble of piano, flute, cello, clarinet and French horn.

name: Riverside Eats & Beats

location.name: Queen Street East between Davies and Empire Ave.

description:
Get ready to taste the eats and feel the beats across 10 vibrant blocks. This year, the 11th Riverside street fest will feature: 

- 50+ local eateries and shops along Queen Street East serving food tasters, sidewalk sales, and specials
- Destination points at five local street closures along Queen East and two local parks including local markets, beer garden, culinary delights, family-friendly activities, and entertainment 
- Free activities: live music, magic shows, face-painting, food/drink specials, giveaways and more!
